perturbation.original_text: "Change of Control" means a change in the power to direct the management or affairs of ISO or the beneficial ownership of more than 51% of the equity securities; provided, however, that becoming a public company with the same management team or changing the beneficial ownership of more than 51% of the equity securities while maintaining the same management team will not constitute a change in control.
perturbation.changed_text: "Change of Control" means a change in the power to direct the management or affairs of ISO or the beneficial ownership of more than 51% of the equity securities; provided, however, that any change in ownership, regardless of management continuity, constitutes a change in control.
perturbation.explanation: The modification alters the definition of 'Change of Control' to include ANY change in ownership, conflicting with standard legal interpretations that often consider management continuity as a mitigating factor. This creates uncertainty about what actions trigger 'Change of Control' clauses, potentially leading to disputes and non-compliance, especially if a minor ownership shift is treated as a major change.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General Corporate Law and Contract Interpretation Principles

perturbation.original_text: "Affiliate" shall mean any entity that directly or indirectly controls, is controlled by or is under common control with a party.
perturbation.changed_text: "Affiliate" shall mean any entity that directly or indirectly has a business relationship with a party.
perturbation.explanation: The modification broadens the definition of "Affiliate" to any entity with a business relationship, removing the element of 'control.' This conflicts with the standard legal definition of affiliate, which centers on ownership and control. This broad definition creates uncertainty in related clauses, potentially affecting liability, confidentiality, and other contractual obligations.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General Corporate Law and Standard Business Definitions

perturbation.original_text: "Confidential Information" shall mean non-public information about, and proprietary materials of, any party as defined and more fully described in Section 9.1.
perturbation.changed_text: "Confidential Information" shall mean any information exchanged between parties, irrespective of whether it is publicly available.
perturbation.explanation: This modification changes the definition of 'Confidential Information' to include all exchanged data, including public information, deviating from the legal standard that requires confidentiality. This could lead to disputes over nondisclosure obligations, as it seeks to protect data not normally considered confidential.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Trade Secret Law and Contract Law regarding Confidentiality
